column4: the administrative center of the Haisyn Raion in Vinnytsia Oblast. Its population is 25
column5: 920. (2015 est.) It is located in the eastern part of the historical region of Podolia.

column1: Hajsyn was first mentioned in 1545. Since 1566 it was part of the Bracław Voivodeship of Poland. In 1744
column2: King Augustus III granted Hajsyn city rights. It was a royal city of Poland. After the Second Partition of Poland in 1793 it was annexed by the Russian Empire.
